Key Match Events: England won by 4 wickets (with 2 balls remaining)
Jos Buttler and Alex Hales posted 75 for the first wicket inside eight overs
Sam Curran was caught on the hook at fine leg by Lahiru Kumara
Pre-Game Insights: Dasun Shanaka opted to bat first due to a used surface at Sydney
Jos Buttler admitted he wanted to bat first for the same reason
Wanindu Hasaranga was expected to play a crucial role in the match
Post-Match Reflections: Ben Stokes was praised for his calm and composed batting at the end of the match
England's win ensured their place in the semi-finals of the T20 World Cup
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pathum Nissanka scored 67 runs for Sri Lanka
Mark Wood was on the podium for the fastest quicks at the World Cup
The match was played on a used surface at Sydney, which affected the spinners' performance
Others: Dawid Malan pulled his groin in the field and was replaced by Chris Jordan
Sri Lanka's openers started strongly, but the team stumbled in the final 10 overs
